1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C. Koskie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason C. Koskie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason C. Koskie was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Jason C. Koskie was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with O.M.K, L.L.K, and AF.
No contact with any minors that are not family, and contact with his children must be approved by his Agent and supervised by an approved adult.

Provide DNA Sample.
No possession of alcohol.
Successfully complete sex offender treatment.
Comply with all sex offender registration requirements for the State of Wisconsin.
Comply with any conditional programming deemed necessary; Dept of Corrections to provide sexual offender treatment while incarcerated.
Pay supervision fees.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#4

records.addlTxt: 2:15 Defendant Jason C. Koskie in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Defendant Jason C. Koskie in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Froelich has reviewed the DOC's PSI and Report: factual changes pg 3 ( add to 2nd sentence) of DOC PSI. Atty Weber objects. Court adds the state's claim as described into DOC's PSI. Atty Froelich: page 4, 1st full paragraph, 3rd sentence. Atty Weber has no objection. Court adds the state's change as described. Atty Weber has reviewd the DOC's PSI and report filed on Def's behalf. Froelich: victim's rights have been complied with. Atty Froelich gives sentencing argument. Request: on Ct#1 20 years initial confinement followed by 10 years ES and on Ct#4 15 years initial confinement followed by 10 years ES. No contact with OMK, ACF and LLK. And all conditions listed on the PSI by the DOC.  Victim Witness Coordinator Erin Mulhollam read a statement written by OMK. Victim ACF's mother read a statement written by ACF and herself. Jacob Koskie, Def's brother, reads a statement. Atty Weber states the minor children do have insurance through August 2018. Atty Weber gives sentencing argument; requests the recommends listed from the Dr's report: 11-14 years: 6-8 year initial confinement and 5-6 years ES. Defendant, Jason Koskie, reads a statement to the courtroom. Court goes over sentencing factors. Court orders on Ct#1 30 years witn 20 years initial confinement followed by 10 years of extended supervision. orders on Ct#4 25 years with 15 years initial confinement followed by 10 years of extended supervision; concurrent. Conditions of extended supervision listed on the PSI:  court costs, DNA sample, successfully complete sex offender treatment, Comply with with all sex offender registration requirements of the State of Wisconsin. No contact with any minors that are not family, any contact with his children must be approved by his Agent and supervised by an approved adult, comply with any conditional programming deemed necessary; DOC to provide sexual offender treatment. No possession of alcohol. Pay supervision fees. No contact with OMK, LLK and AF. 395 days credit. Restitution TBD w/in 30 days and if granted will be a condition of extended supervision.

10:49 15CF55 also heard at this time. Defendant Jason C. Koskie in court, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: 16CF48 plead to count 1, requests PDI, sec off. registration and treatment, count 16CF48 moves to dismiss, count 3 16CF48 moves to dismiss, count 4 16CF48 enter guilty plea, 16CF55 moves to dismiss. Parties agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to counts 1 and 4 in 16CF48 of amended information.  Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEAS, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of counts 1 and 4 in amended information on 16CF48, counts 2 and 3 of 16CF48 court dismisses, 16CF55 court orders dismissed. Court orders PSI, sentencing to be scheduled at least 45 days out. Parties to see JA for scheduling. 11:01
